wikipedia_page.main: Richard Withington Bromiley Sanderson (15 January 1847 – 26 April 1906) was an English cricketer active in 1870 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Manchester and died in Rhode Island. He appeared in one first-class match, scoring seven runs with a highest score of 6.

response: Richard Sanderson (born 5 March 1953 in Taplow) is an English singer, best known for his hit songs "Reality", "So Many Ways" and "She's a Lady".

Sanderson has two compilation albums: The Best of Richard Sanderson, released in 1984 as a two CD album, and Greatest Hits: The Very Best of Richard Sanderson, another two CD album where the first CD has digital remasterizations of his hits and the second CD has covers of his favourite songs.
*2010: Greatest Hits: The Best of Richard Sanderson
